query: I do not want to be a burden on anyone.

results.document: I’ll try. I just don’t want to be a burden.
results.ai_response: You’re not a burden. You’re human, and needing care doesn’t make you weak — it makes you real.

results.document: I don’t like feeling out of control.
results.ai_response: That aversion likely protected you once. We don’t remove it—we renegotiate when it’s needed.

results.document: It feels scary to imagine not being needed.
results.ai_response: Of course it does. Being needed can feel like proof that we matter. Without it, there’s a lot of uncertainty.
People rarely fall apart the way they fear. What usually happens is temporary destabilization followed by integration.

results.document: I don’t want to ignore myself anymore.
results.ai_response: That intention alone is powerful. It’s a promise to yourself that you matter too.
